boardgame.name: Raider's Ruined Temple of the Lost Ark
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined desert temple is carved into the sides of a ravine, with fast clear water flowing below. Tall palms line the sides of the cliffs, while other leafy plants creep along the ground, growing on the rubble amidst wildflowers.

The largest room has been turned into a mess hall, with tables laden with drinks, weapons, maps, paperwork, books and food waiting before a raised platform with a chest, overgrown with flowers.
Some rooms have stone benches covered with urns of the dead, while others contain desks or beds. Two more are small cells, and out the front one of the caves has been turned into storage for food and wine, as well as an outpost. Two of the rooms are filled with pools of blue water.
Rickety wooden bridges connect the walkways in places where the original stone has fallen away. Some lead to large rooms, while others are only small and filled with stone benches of urns. Birds cry loudly as they fly between nests in the cliffs.

Adventure Seed

You are hired by a recruiter in a tavern to unlock an ancient chest at a recently-discovered ruined temple. It is sealed with magic and physical locks, so their excavation team needs someone who’s good with the arcane arts and lock picking to open it. If you succeed, you’ll be paid well.
They guide you through mountains to the rest of the excavation team in the temple. Only, once you arrive, you’re greeted by three dirty men at the entrance—who the guide doesn’t recognize.
WHAT’S HAPPENING? After the guide left to recruit the help the excavation needed, bandits took over the site. The group of historians hadn’t expected to be attacked in such a remote location, and only had two guards with them.
The bandits have locked them up in two tiny cells, which are very uncomfortable for a team of 10 people. In the meantime, the outlaws have been feasting on the excavation’s food stores while trying to unlock the chest.
The historians told the bandits that they hired some people to open the chest, and upon seeing your party they will guess you’re the team. The bandits tell you that they have a new deal for you, and that if you help them open the chest they’ll give you a share of whatever’s inside. Will you help the bandits, leaving the excavators as prisoners, or will you risk your life to save them?
The chest itself is made of brass, with gold bindings, and has melted into the stone beneath it. It radiates warmth and is hot to the touch. There is spiteful fire djinn trapped within, and if released, he will emerge with a flaming sword and thank you for freeing him. However, he will not return to his realm empty-handed after such a long time; when he returns, his castle will need sprucing up, and to do that, he needs slaves.
As you were kind enough to release him, he will spare you. But, depending on which group has survived, he will demand either the bandits or the excavation team be handed over to him as slaves… If you refuse to give either of them, he’ll attack.

boardgame.name: Undermountain Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rotten wooden walkways and crumbling lookouts span the darkness of this underdark gorge, clinging to stone pillars or the hollowed-out cliffs in which living quarters have been built.

Twisting stone tunnels lead to old rooms filled with nothing but spider’s webs and old displaced bricks that once stood strong within this ruins foundation.

boardgame.name: Underdark Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wooden walkways and lookouts span the darkness of this underdark gorge, clinging to stone pillars or the hollowed-out cliffs in which living quarters have been built.

Twisting stone tunnels lead to rooms filled with strange alchemical equipment, seer’s orbs and bookshelves full of esoteric secrets. Other tunnels lead to a tavern full of tables, food and good ale as well as storage areas.

boardgame.name: Pirate's Underdark Hideout
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Colorful coral and brilliant clear waters have filled this underdark gorge, into which a village has been built. Wooden walkways and lookouts span the water, clinging to stone pillars or the hollowed-out cliffs in which living quarters have been built.

Twisting stone tunnels lead to rooms filled with strange alchemical equipment, seer’s orbs and bookshelves full of esoteric secrets. Other tunnels lead to a tavern full of tables, food and good ale as well as storage areas.

boardgame.name: Kirin's Ruined Coral Bastion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These brilliant clear waters are full of colorful coral and lively exotic fish. Few would know that this old temple’s ruins are down here. Twisting stone tunnels lead into the cliff-side to old rooms where the priests used to live before the bastion was abandoned.

boardgame.name: Ratmen's Old Mine Warren
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rotten wooden walkways and crumbling lookouts span the darkness of this underdark gorge, clinging to stone pillars or the hollowed-out cliffs in which living quarters have been built.

Twisting stone tunnels lead to rooms filled with soiled straw and leather bedding, wooden pikes have been set into the stonewalls and covered in trinkets, skulls and the blood of those that have been brought here.

boardgame.name: Underdark Fungal Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Glowing fungi line the sides of this underdark gorge, into which a village has been built. Wooden walkways and lookouts span the darkness, clinging to stone pillars or the hollowed-out cliffs in which living quarters have been built.

Twisting stone tunnels lead to rooms filled with strange alchemical equipment, seer’s orbs and bookshelves full of esoteric secrets. Other tunnels lead to living quarters, a tavern full of tables, food and good ale as well as storage areas.

Adventure Seed

While traveling through the Underdark, you are kidnapped by dark dwarves. You wake up in a small, stone cell. Everyone is stripped of their possessions, but left with their underclothes—all except one party member, who is completely naked.
An old green dwarf is locked in there with you. He mumbles to himself constantly and pokes you with a stick if you come too close. If you try to talk to him he’ll babble gibberish (something about seagulls), but will get aggressive if you try to take his stick.
The dark dwarves take each of you away one by one, walking you up thin stone corridors and wooden walkways overlooking a bottomless chasm filled with glowing mushrooms. When you arrive at a large alchemist’s station, they throw a handful of powder in your face, before returning you to your cell.
Everyone’s powder had different colors, and within a couple of hours their effects begin to show:

One party member is relaxed and happy; carefree.
Another is unable to stop laughing. Everything is hilarious, no matter how mundane.
Someone else sees eyes watching him at the corner of his vision, but whenever he turns to see, they’re gone.
One adventurer is absolutely fine, except he keeps talking to someone called Pawl (who clearly isn’t there).
Yet another has had their mind opened to the fourth dimension, and now knows with utter certainty that his free will is an illusion. An interdimensional being is controlling their every move...
Lastly, someone’s accent has been inexplicably changed to a foreign one.



WHAT’S HAPPENING? The Duergar live in this Underdark settlement, harvesting the glowing mushrooms and processing them into a powdered drug that they then traffic. They have tested new drugs on you, by mixing novel combinations of substances in with the powdered mushrooms.
If you don’t do something, they might keep you there forever; testing new substances on you until your mind breaks, like the old green dwarf’s—and perhaps, even then, they’ll continue to run tests with the more… deadly substances.

boardgame.name: Abandoned Seaside Cavern Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A large cavern, filled with flowing water and pillars on which a large vessel can be tied. Stone floors, patched with metal grids where they have fallen away, lead to a series of rooms sealed by thick, reinforced doors.

boardgame.name: Pirate's Icy Cavern Hideout
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ice frosts the deck of a ship docked within this hidden cave hideout. Metal ramps lead off the vessel, over frigid water and floating shards of ice, and further into the pirate’s cavern. Ballistae guard the entrance, while small row-boats wait docked and ready to use by the ship.
Pillars with lit torches support the cavern, while a network of rooms form a veritable fortress within the seaside cliff. A mess hall is sheltered from the frost, and filled with food-laden tables and barrels of wine. Elsewhere, hammocks stretch from wall to wall as rudimentary quarters.

boardgame.name: Underwater Temple of Koolan
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fish dart around statues of robed figures holding bowls for offerings. Seaweed and coral grow around them, drifting in the underwater currents. Stone pathways and metal grids lead deeper into the temple, where a series of interconnected rooms reveal a large statue of the hooded figure of Koolan.
Gaps in the floor reveal descending sea cliffs, leading down to darkness far, far below.

boardgame.name: Riptide Laboratory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A pitch-black whirlpool churns and gurgles like a greedy beast at the centre of this laboratory, surrounded by stone platforms and eight pillars. Metal grids criss-cross the network of walkways, with steps leading out of the dark cavern and into a series of rooms which lead to the entrance.
Blue lights glow on cold, stone walls within those chambers. They are filled with pools or containment cylinders of blue liquid—but what are they for? And why does the carved face of some tentacled being look over them?

boardgame.name: Pirate's Cavern Hideout
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A ship docked within this hidden cave hideout has fish scattered across its decks, alongside storage barrels. Metal ramps lead off the vessel and further into the pirate’s cavern, past the ballistae, and small row-boats.
Pillars with lit torches support the cavern, while a network of rooms form a veritable fortress within the seaside cliff. A mess hall is scattered with food-laden tables and barrels of wine, while elsewhere hammocks stretch from wall to wall as rudimentary quarters.

boardgame.name: Mindflayer's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The green elderbrain glows eerily in a pool of ooze, tentacles reaching out between stone platforms and metal grates. Pillars hold up this underground lair, while smaller rooms form a veritable maze around the entrance.

Pools of green liquid filled with larvae wait near the carved face of a mindflayer god, while further in various containment canisters line the walls… but what’s inside them?

Adventure Seed

While walking the city streets you’re approached by a portly man wearing a black coat and leather gloves. He seems a little nervous as he approaches you, but quickly explains that his master has sought you out from far away and wishes to have dinner with you at the best tavern in the city; The Ocean’s Bounty. He wishes to discuss an incredibly lucrative business arrangement that requires someone of your particular skills...

Before leaving, he tosses you a small coin purse that jingles with the sound of gold and gems, claiming you’ll receive an even larger purse should you join them at dinner.

When you arrive at the tavern the portly man is waiting for you at the door. He invites you in, but the tavern’s completely empty—apart from a shadowy figure close to the fireplace, sitting in a large wooden chair engraved with the likeness of an octopus.

They motion you over, and as you approach you see he is a man of pale complexion, with a jewelled necklace and large, gem-encrusted rings on his hands.

Once sitting, he begins discussing philosophical topics such as free will, eventually getting around to his need of experienced sell-swords for a thesis he is in the midst of creating. He is researching mindflayers, creatures of malicious intent, domination and selfishness.

He thinks these creatures are not inherently so, but that the elderbrain takes away their free will by passively warping the minds of those that sleep within its domain; causing them to crave dominion over others at all costs. But to prove his theory, he needs you to infiltrate a colony and dispose of the brain so that he may study the results via one-way scrying devices. In return, he will pay great riches, including rare magical artifacts.

WHAT’S GOING ON? The man who has hired you is not what he seems, if you search for information about him around the city you will find he is a wealthy benefactor to many noble charities, and owns many properties around the city including the tavern called The Ocean’s Bounty. What you will not discover is that he is a mindflayer in disguise. He wears a powerful magical amulet that changes his appearance so that he may walk among humans, as well as a plethora of other magical rings and items.

The strange thing about this mindflayer however, is that he is not like the others. He acts with kindness and concern over what is moral, and he wants to know why. Why do his brethren all act in unison with their desire for dominion, but not him? Is he just an aberration? A freak within his own species, or is there more to it? What is free will, truly?

boardgame.name: Angels Ravine Cemetery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mossy low cut stone walls guide paths throughout this sprawling cemetery where large thorny bushes and tangled wildflowers have began to take hold.

The paths lead down into a basin surrounded by cliffs, above stand angelic statues holding swords on either side of an old stone bridge and below lie mausoleums which have been built into the cliff face.

On the far end of the cemetery up a set of stairs, lies a large circular crypt wherein sarcophagi have been built in it’s walls and five broken ornate caskets lie central to an engraved pillar.

boardgame.name: Crumbling River Temple of Jaskar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mossy low cut stone walls guide paths throughout this ancient temples gardens where large thorny bushes and tangled wildflowers have taken hold.

The path leads to an old bridge which crosses over a river, angelic statues holding swords on either side of the bridge stand watch. On the far end of the temple grounds lies a large circular temple an old set of stairs leads into the river basin, used at one time for small boats to dock.

Inside only some few pedestals remain covered in old clay pots and fragments of other crafts. In the center of the chamber an elevated circular platform stands out, perhaps it holds a secret?

boardgame.name: Underwater Mausoleum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Low cut stone walls mark the boundary of this grave site siting just above the abyssal reefs which reach down into the darkness. Strange corals jut from the rocky cliffs and colorful fish of all types swiftly dart in and out of hiding holes.

A bridge with angelic statues holding swords on either side of the bridge stand watch over this place. On the far end of the cemetery up a set of stairs, lies a large circular crypt wherein sarcophagi have been built in it’s walls and five broken ornate caskets lie central to an engraved pillar.

boardgame.name: Valanari's Graveyard Oasis
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Low cut sandstone walls guide paths throughout this sprawling cemetery where large thorny bushes and tangled wildflowers have began to take hold, the sands have already covered much of the structures that once sat here.

Paths lead down into a basin surrounded by cliffs, above stand angelic statues holding swords on either side of an old stone bridge and below lie mausoleums which have been built into the cliff face, in the center lies a small oasis, perhaps the only surface water for hundreds of miles around.

On the far end of the cemetery up a set of stairs, lies a large circular crypt wherein sarcophagi have been built in it’s walls and five broken ornate caskets lie central to an engraved pillar.

boardgame.name: Darrowmeer Burial Grounds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mossy low cut stone walls guide paths throughout this sprawling mist-soaked cemetery where large thorny bushes and tangled weeds have began to take hold.

The paths lead down into a bone filled basin surrounded by cliffs, above stand angelic statues holding swords on either side of an old stone bridge and below lie mausoleums which have been built into the cliff face.

On the far end of the cemetery up a set of stairs, lies a large circular crypt wherein sarcophagi have been built in it’s walls and five broken ornate caskets lie central to an engraved pillar.

Adevnture Seed

An unnatural fog has descended on the township of Darrowmeer after their burial grounds were desecrated by grave robbers and while the robbers were dealt with the mist remained. You’ve been tasked with entering the burial grounds with a priest to reconsecrate the mausoleum, however the priest is concerned that this action could cause the dead to briefly rise from their graves in anguish and attempt to stop the ritual.

When you enter the mausoleum, you’re greeted by five ghostly figures hovering over broken tombs, they introduce themselves as Lady Jane, a cleric and worshiper of the light, The Red Duke, a fighter and renown knight, Silvia Greenbarrow, a druid of the sacred grove, Elmeth Zigoth, a famous wizard and Jarnock, ranger of the great reachs.

Each offers to assist you in your goal of reconsecrating the mausoleum but will not work with the others, during this time of talk they jest with each other and boast about their personal prowess and achievements during their life.

Each ghost will offer you a unique boon while the consecration in progress which are listed below:

Lady Jane will assist in the consecration which will cause holy damage to any undead that enter the mausoleum every turn, and change your weapons damage type to holy.

The Red Duke will empower you, increasing your critical range and damage for each enemy struck down.

Silvia Greenbarrow will grow large blossoming rose bushes covering up to 10 squares with sharp thorns that cannot be passed through, any who try take slashing damage.

Elmeth Zigoth will grant you a random arcane symbol based off the result of a D4 each turn that grants different effects:
1. Double your movement speed and gain flying.
2. Triple your movement speed and jump height.
3. Double your movement speed, you may move through walls and enemies as if you were a ghost.
4. You may teleport up to double your movement speed, teleporting does not provoke opportunity attacks.

Jarnock will summon animal spirits to assist you in your battle, healing your wounds and increasing your resilience to damage as well as environmental effects.

When the consecration begins just as the priest feared, the undead begin to rise, dozens, perhaps even hundreds clamber from their moist graves and shamble towards the mausoleum. You’ll need to hold them off and protect the priest for five rounds.

After this time the consecration is complete and a large pillar of light will project high into the sky from the peak of the mausoleum breaking away the mists and allow the sun to shine once more, at this very moment all remaining undead fall to the ground defeated.

boardgame.name: Ruined Temple Oasis
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sunlight filters in through the cracking ceiling on this ruined desert temple, dancing on sparkling water in a clear oasis. Platforms are set across the water, with two bridges meeting to form a platform in the middle.
Tall palms grow out of intricate stone tiles, alongside wildflowers and waterlilies. Sand piles on top of the cracked pavers, while many of the support pillars holding up the temple’s roof are also fractured. Fallen stone and rubble lay dispersed on the ground. You can hear the cry of birds and the flutter of wings from where they roost, high above.

boardgame.name: Tomb Robbers of the Crystal Frontier
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the Crystal Frontier, a desolate magic stained wasteland where fabulous crystal spires and fortresses plummet from the skies to tempt the gold desperate and the bold with magical gems and golden treasures. Find your fortune or find your death as you plunder the fallen sky tomb of an Empyrean despot.


SCHEME with the unnatural denizens of the Crystal Tomb!
UNRAVEL the secrets of the Dead King and his realm of misrule!
LOOT strange magics and opulent treasures from beyond the sky's vault!


A complete 60 page adventure for Level 1 characters, and introduction to the Crystal Frontier setting. While built to support campaign play, the adventure ready for use as a drop in adventure locale almost any fantasy world, or as a one-shot. Designed for and stated with OSE, Tomb Robbers of the Crystal Frontier emphasizes problem solving, faction intrigue and exploration in the the tradition of classic dungeon crawl adventures, but with a phantasmagoric fantasy Western aesthetic.

boardgame.name: Black Dragon (Volume 1, Number 3)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The third issue of Black Dragon contains a comprehensive system for generating unique spell books, a new monster inspired by the Rankin Bass animated "Hobbit" film of 1977, and a miniatures review looking at magic-users!

boardgame.name: Der Clou: The Great Train Robbery
boardgame.description:
Like the basic game, the campaign is designed for 1­3 players and includes a total of 4 new break­ins. These are connected to each other by content and your gang of thieves gains more experience with each break­in. You also have the opportunity to buy new tools and to prepare yourself with your loot.

This game is to help the small game stores through the time of closure. Order something online at your local game store and send a photo or scan of it to clou@boardgame-racoon.de. You will receive the "The great train robbery" campaign with 4 extra scenarios via email as soon as it is finished.

boardgame.name: The Sticky GM
boardgame.description:
From the Back Cover

This book is for Game Masters, or Dungeon Masters, or referees of role-playing games of all descriptions that have prepared sessions that have gone awry. When players turn left, not right or take an instant and inexplicable dislike to an NPC that was going to be pivotal to an upcoming adventure.

Using the simple technique in this book will lead to you using everything you prepare for your role-playing game sessions. It will give you control over the pacing of sessions, and it strives to create the most exciting games for you and your players...

...and it all driven just using the humble post-it-note to control just about everything.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Biomes 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides a hundred different locations for a big fantasy map. Included in each entry is name of location (which indicates biome/location type) as well as a descriptor that could be a lead in for an interesting encounter, adventure hook, source of treasure, community to visit, etc.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Biomes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides a hundred different locations for a big fantasy map. Included in each entry is name of location (which indicates biome/location type) as well as a descriptor that could be a lead in for an interesting encounter, adventure hook, source of treasure, community to visit, etc.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Character Quirks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides a hundred different quirks for fantasy role playing characters. Examples include pet peeves, manners of dress, superstitions, and behavioral elements. This product is system generic and should be usable with most any table top role playing game without difficulty.

boardgame.name: 50 List: Treasure Chest Loot
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides fifty different items that you might find locked away in a fantasy treasure chest. Included in each entry is a general description of the item as well as the item’s value in gold coins. Suitable for most table top fantasy role playing games.

boardgame.name: 50 List: Treasure Chest Loot 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides fifty different items that you might find locked away in a fantasy treasure chest. Included in each entry is a general description of the item as well as the item’s value in gold coins. Suitable for most table top fantasy role playing games.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 36
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Decor Pack 07
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With this pack, we are trying to fill some gaps in our library and also update the “Old” assets, bringing them up to our new standards

We have a lot of new Fireplaces, Lamps. Street Lamps & various Lanterns in this pack for you!

Total # of Assets in this pack: 823!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Decor Pack 08
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With this pack, we are trying to fill some gaps in our library and also update the “Old” assets, bringing them up to our new standards

We have a lot of new Cloths, Wheelbarrows, Training Dummies & Targets, Curtains, Moss overlays and more in this pack for you!

Total # of Assets in this pack: 1435!

boardgame.name: Table Clutter Pack 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New Table Clutter is here!

This one has a healthy mix of Adventuring Gear and other goodies!

Hope you guys like them!

Total # of Assets in this pack: 826!

boardgame.name: Table Clutter Pack 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

New Table Clutter is here!

This one focusing on some Food! Specifically Breads, Fruits and Vegetables!

Hope you guys like them!

Total # of Assets in this pack: 473!

boardgame.name: In Scarlet Flames
boardgame.description:
From the Wizards of the Coast website:

Two Red Wizards of Thay have undertaken a secret mission into the High Moors east of the Sword Coast. They are searching for something or someone. Whatever their goal out there in the cold and windswept hills, if the Red Wizards want to keep it secret then it is probably best uncovered swiftly for the good of everyone else. Even the mercenaries who escorted them into the wilderness earlier agree: someone should stop them.

Pursuing the Red Wizards leads the adventurers to a barrow mound in the wild grasses of the High Moors. At the barrow, they discover the remnants of a wizards' sanctum still being plundered. The fate of its lore and treasures is up to the characters. Without caution, things may get out of hand.

This Dungeons & Dragons adventure is written to suit four to six characters of 8th level. With this text and the core D&D manuals, you have everything you need to play.

boardgame.name: RoboMon
boardgame.description:
RoboMon is an exploration-focused, story-driven, open-world game of robot combat for 1-2 players.

After a series of wars and climate events, most of the world's animals went extinct. RoboMon were invented to piece the environment and ecosystems back together. But it wasn't long before people figured out they could be reprogrammed for some pretty sweet robot battles.

You pick things up 50 years after the world has been put back together. Take on the role of a brand new RoboMon trainer exploring the world and attempting to become a fully licensed RoboMon Ranger and the greatest trainer on the planet.

Explore the book of maps, and work your way through the adventure book to complete quests, solve puzzles, and defeat gym leaders. Earn enough badges to become a fully licensed RoboMon Ranger and win the game!

Each game session can take 5 minutes or 5 hours depending on how long you want to play.

boardgame.name: Ashes Reborn: The Gorrenrock Survivors
boardgame.description:
Phoenixborn Lulu Firststone has been reimagined with a full deck for Ashes Reborn. Lulu uses time and natural magic for explosive combat and to survive the harsh environment where her city, Gorrenrock, stands.
Lulu is a very hardy fighter and direct combat is her style of choice. Lulu has the ability to bolster her companions, granting them imbued strength in the form of status tokens and the special Spark alteration. At any turn, one of the fighters of Gorrenrock can exert themselves and fire off a final blast of damage, showing that no ally of Lulu’s is going down easy. And when bolstering her allies isn’t enough, Lulu is more than ready to take matters into her own hands with her signature attack, Phoenix Barrage! With the power of the Phoenix within her, Lulu can launch three spirited blasts of fire- -- with one aimed straight at her final foe!
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Ashes Reborn Gorrenrock Survivors
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Ashes Reborn: Rise of the Phoenixborn

boardgame.name: Creature Tokens 19
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version
(for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

Additional batch of SRD Creatures

This pack contains 7 new Creature Tokens, 5 Dragon Wyrmlings and 2 Kobolds! each with multiple color variants:

Total # of tokens in this pack: 81!

boardgame.name: Creature Spirits Pack 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All tokens are in PNG format and high resolution (400dpi) just in case you need a bigger version (for example Enlarge spell) you wont lose any detail.

We do one of these every couple of months to catch-up a little bit before the tokens pile up even more

This pack contains all tokens from “Adversaries – Desert Guards & Cavalry, Hero Tokens – Pack 03, Hero Tokens – Pack 04 and Adversaries – Goblins” in Spirit Forms.

All in 4 Color Variants as usual (Blue, Green, Purple, White).

Total # of tokens in this pack: 220!

boardgame.name: Ashes Reborn: The Messenger of Peace
boardgame.description:
Phoenixborn Orrick Gilstream uses time and charm magic to keep peace a top priority amidst an ever-raging war.

Orrick is a skilled practitioner of meditation, and his insight offers him the ability to not only improve his magic proficiency through meditation, but also expand access to options other Phoenixborn cannot. Orrick slips into an "Awakened State" where he is able to give direct damage to both enemy units and Phoenixborn, bringing his conflicts to a dramatic conclusion!
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Ashes Reborn The Messenger of Peace
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Ashes Reborn: Rise of the Phoenixborn

boardgame.name: Stars and Scales
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

‘The Old Ones anticipated all. In their wisdom, they left two things: a Great Plan to vanquish the Eternal Enemy and we who shall execute it.’

— Lord Ximoyuxe, Starmaster of the Fourth Spawning

Stars and Scales explores the mysterious Seraphon — reptilian warriors trailing comet tails of light and burning atmosphere, wielding golden artefacts that crackle with celestial energies. This PDF gives GMs and players a wealth of resources for using the Seraphon in their campaign and explores Seraphon society, their goals, the different types of Seraphon, and what tasks they might request of the Soulbound. Stars and Scales also comes with a number of one-page adventures centred on the Seraphon which GMs can drop into their game as short adventures or expand into a greater campaign.

PLAYABLE SERAPHON!

Stars and Scales also has everything you need to play Seraphon characters. These strange and alien creatures have been designed for use in one-shot adventures, allowing players to take on the role of a mysterious Seraphon who seeks to help a Binding and then disappearing to pursue another aspect of the Great Plan. This PDF includes Seraphon Species Bonus, rules for playing as either Starborne or Coalesced Seraphon, subfaction bonuses and, most importantly, two new Archetypes — Skink Starpriest and Saurus Oldblood.

boardgame.name: Lorica & Thorax: Regolamento
boardgame.description:
Classic Ancient miniature wargame rules.
Dice, tape measure and counters (disorder, route, charge) are needed to play.

This book also contains 10 army lists
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Greek & Persian conflicts of the 4th century BC
History: Wars in the Ancient Near East

boardgame.name: Garibaldini, all'attacco!
boardgame.description:
Garibaldini, all'attacco!, Garibaldini, attack! is a three-dimensional wargame rulebook.
It is designed to recreate the battles of the Risorgimento period.
It is a simple and agile system, suitable for small / medium sized games, playable in a short time, even in multiplayer.

The combat formations are the brigades, made up of the tactical units typical of this period (infantry battalions, cavalry regiments, artillery batteries).

The player, in command of a brigade, must maneuver better than his own opponent if he wants to prevail in this type of war that alternates moments of studied preparation for furious assaults!

—description from the publisher (translated)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

In this volume you will find historical battles, clarification of the rules and the army list for the Bourbon troops.

This volume does not contain the rules, in order to play ownership of the basic rules "Garibaldini, attack!" is necessary.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: BrainBites: Shakespeare
boardgame.description:
Do you know your Bottom from your Puck? In this quirky quiz each card refers to a famous Shakespearian character or play.

There are three questions per card worth either 1, 2 or 3 brain cells. Be the first to fill your brain with brain cells in this game for all the family!

You choose the level of difficulty and the correct answer fills your brain card with 1, 2 or 3 brain cells. The first to fill their card is the winner.

boardgame.name: Errant Fool
boardgame.description:
From the description:

What if the hero of the story was anything but? Thinking themselves invincible, ready to take on the day and save the world. Sweet Svmmer child, how foolish can you be?

boardgame.name: Demon Dogrider / Hellhound
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Demon Dogrider

Your growth has been stunted by a dark pact that binds you to a canid companion and feeds its fury. While some may fear you as a goblin, you have gained much from this bond.

Hellhound

Born of fire and darkness, hellhounds delight in tearing apart anything that crosses their path. It is said that those who have never committed evil are spared, but no one has ever tested that theory.

boardgame.name: Hatamoto
boardgame.description:
Hatamoto is a simple ruleset that aims to reproduce and play great medieval and Renaissance battles in the Far East involving two or more players, within a reasonable time.

The philosophy of the game is to make players use the various types of troops according to their actual use on the battlefield, without overloading the game with myriads of different factors for weapons and armor.

This volume includes the basic and optional rules for playing and the Army Lists to recreate the Japanese armies of the Late Middle Ages and the Early Renaissance.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Mantel
boardgame.description:
Mantel is a trick-taking game for exactly three players which uses suit-less cards. Each player receives an identical set of rank cards which they place face up in front of themselves and a random selection of colored cubes which they will place on the cards to determine the specific combination of rank and suit which they have played to a trick.

After receiving their cubes, players will bid on how many tricks they expect to win, and after three rounds of play, the player with the most points wins.

In this volume you will find:

23 new Army Lists, clarifications for theirs use,
rules for introducing "Historical Commanders" into your games,
cards of "Historical Commanders" with their personal characteristics, clarifications,
optional rules (facing a flank charge, cavalry break-off, mock cavalry charge and landings),
landing markers and rotation rulers.


This volume does not contain the rules, in order to play, the Imperi e Feudiruleset is necessary.

–Translated description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rewe: The Mapuche Sacred Places
boardgame.description:
REWE is an abstract majority game for 2 players inspired by the Mapuche culture, an indigenous people of South America. You will impersonate a Machi, spiritual guide and you will employ her/his knowledge in obtaining the right combinations of curative herbs - the Lawen - to heal the polluted territories.

There are 3 types of cards:


Lawen cards: these are the resources of the Machi
Luku cards: the effects of these cards last for the whole duration of a round.
Küme cards: represent an help for the Machi


How to play:


Each turn starts moving the Rehue turn counter of one step forward along the external circle of the Kultrun board.
Therefore the first Machi launches the Wenu dice: the outcome will determine the position of the Wenu token on its scale numbered from da 1 to 8.
Then the Machi's round starts. He draws from the Lawen deck the number of the cards indicated by the Wenu and adds them to his Yapaq (bag) and takes a step or two, otherwise stays still.
The player must move his Machi token trying to get in touch with the Ngen (Cosmic spirit), that is being in correspondence of the dashed line at the end of which the Ngen token is positioned, in order to trigger the colour of the Rewe for his turn.
Once moved, each Machi chooses the number of Lawen cards indicated by the Wenu scale and play them.
A specific combination of Lawen corresponds to each Rewe or sacred place.
In order to get the Lif (purifying agent), a sufficient number of Lawen is requested.
The Machi checks if the combination occurred which generates the Lif.
He chooses to store it in the Ruka space of his board or places it on a polluted territory.
At the end of the game, the Machi who gets more Final Points (bonus, lif cubes, and regenerated Rewe) wins.

boardgame.name: dados
boardgame.description:
Dados is a trick-taking game for two teams of 2 players which uses dice instead of cards. While players must follow suit, they cannot play a number previously played.

At the end of a hand, each team scores points for certain numbers of dice collected. The game ends when one team has reached a point threshold, and the team with the most points wins.

listing.notes: Buyer pays shipping. Paypal/Venmo/Zelle, cash for local pick up in DC also acceptable.

boardgame.name: Cuban Front, Battle for Cuba (fan expansion for Third World War: Battle for Germany)
boardgame.description:
Battle for Cuba in the fading days of the Cold War.

The objective is as the Cuban player is to delay NATO reinforcements to Europe in the Third World War.

Each side has a fixed set of units (counters)to either take over or defend Cuba in the Cold War.

This game is an Fan Expansion on an old game Published in the 80s called Third World War. Third World war covered Europe and the Middle East - we created a brand new region or Front in Cuba.

The Game uses maps dice and counters.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Third World War: Battle for Germany

boardgame.name: The Charlatan's Loss
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A meeting of chance races into the woods!

This five page adventure is designed to be either a standalone introductory adventure or dropped into any campaign as an introductory session zero or random travel encounter to introduce new characters.

Summary: After a chance encounter with a huckster, they find that an amulet has gone missing. Can the players recover the missing amulet or is it lost for all eternity? This adventure module can be used as the end of your Session 0 to introduce the characters after they've been created.

Who is this designed for: This adventure is designed for a Level 1 session 0, but it can be used for later levels to introduce new player characters. Keep in mind though that the monsters as written will not pose much of a threat.

Estimated time to play: 1 - 2 hours, depending on length of rpg more than on combat.

boardgame.name: Rescue in the Vexing Crypt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A single session adventure in the depths of a dungeon where surprises lurk at every turn. This adventure is designed to able to be dropped into any campaign as a travel encounter. I designed this adventure as a non-combat, trap and puzzle dungeon.

boardgame.name: The Sirensong Pool
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This short encounter is designed to designed to be dropped into any campaign as a random travel encounter.

Summary: Coming across a forest shrine to a moon goddess the local friar asks the characters to go to a pool to collect some water. There they meet a lovely woman of the water who demands entertainment.

This adventure is designed for a Level 1-2 party though it can be used at higher levels with some adjustments.

boardgame.name: The Night's Entertainment
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Summary: The shadow of a seance threatens kind community!

As the characters come to a popular crossroads there is a small circus setting up for a performance, hoping to attract attention before heading into more civilized lands. Unfortunately their sage manages to contact something they didn't expect.

boardgame.name: Ambush at the Gate
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Summary: "Wailing Warriors Whisked off to Wilderness Wasp World

Can the adventurers find the mind of the hive and free the townsfolk harrassed by a malevolence beyond the maze?"

This short adventure is designed to be able to be either a standalone adventure or dropped into any campaign as a random travel encounter.

boardgame.name: The Six Fingered Hand
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Summary: "Stone Secrets Skirmish Stalwart Swashbucklers!"

As the adventurers fall under the spell of a mysterious green weasel they descend into history to find the remains of a despot left too long undisturbed.

This short adventure is designed to be able to be either a standalone adventure or dropped into any campaign as a random city adventure.

boardgame.name: Static Blood Moon
boardgame.description:
Each time the moon glows that beautiful pinkish-red color, the Gyrples (in their various tribes) host Blood Moon ceremonies. These ceremonies are meant to dig deep into their collective mind’s eye, hoping to satisfy the Great Sage who always rewards a good host. Invite a jiving group of Gyrples from neighboring tribes and you’ll be rewarded with a plethora of prime sustenance for the psyche of a Gyrple: Dendryke root. Earn enough of this Dendryke root and the Great Sage may allow the sun to set one final time, ceasing time, and leaving you to bask in the glory that is being the one to set forth the Static Blood Moon—truly any Gyrple’s idea of paradise.

Static Blood Moon is an abstract strategy, dice drafting/dice placement game for 2 players, which plays over three rounds in about 45 minutes. Players take turns drafting dice, placing them on their player boards (creating unique scoring combos), and scoring points. The player with the most points at the end of three rounds wins!

boardgame.name: 6: Siege Year 2: High Impact
boardgame.description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege.

Year 2 - High Impact adds 8 operators to the base game. All of them being from the second year, or the second season, of the video game. They expand upon existing mechanisms and provide different options. And with the expanded roster, you’ll have more creative freedom while drafting your squad. Some Operators really benefit from synergies, while others are particularly suited for a specific environment

The 4 attackers all have 2 Run and 5 Stamina. No one’s super tanky, no one’s super nimble. However, all four have abilities that will disrupt defense. Jackal and Dokkaebi are perfect for pinging and revealing enemies. With her Candelas, Ying can stun them while Zofia excels at ranged destruction with her rounds.

On the defenders’ side, the four profiles are very different. Mira improves defenses from her team at the beginning of the game, but can also pierce ceiling to help Operators shoot from Upstairs… Lesion and Ela, thanks to their Gu and Grzmot mines, are going to weaken attackers who cross specific thresholds. Vigil, however, will be able to stay in the shadows for as long as he wants, only to appear at the right moment.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 6: Siege Year 3: Hard Breach
boardgame.description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege.

Year 3 - Hard Breach adds 8 operators to the base game. All of them being from the third year, or the third season, of the video game. They expand upon existing mechanisms and provide different options. And with the expanded roster, you’ll have more creative freedom while drafting your squad. Some Operators really benefit from synergies, while others are particularly suited for a specific environment

For attackers, Maverick and Nomad can help their teammates to move with their Orange Destroy ability. Maverick’s blowtorch especially enhances his wallbreaching capabilities. Finka and Lion use high-tech, respectively nanobots, to heal allies, or ping enemies with drones.

Defenders are all about preparing the field before the game starts. Evil Eye cameras from Maestro not only surveil, they also shoot! Rtila claws from Kaïd also deal damage. Clash’s shield protects her but also shoots stunning projectiles. Alibi is the least protected of the lot, but is a nightmare to locate with her holo prisma.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 6: Siege Year 4: Dark Horizon
boardgame.description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege.

Year 4 - Dark Horizons adds 8 operators to the base game. All of them being from the fourth year, or the fourth season, of the video game. They expand upon existing mechanisms and provide different options. And with the expanded roster, you’ll have more creative freedom while drafting your squad. Some Operators really benefit from synergies, while others are particularly suited for a specific environment

Attackers will have the Aussie Gridlock, an Operator who is very sturdy, and able to fortify an area she has control over. Danish Nøkk can explore the area for her team without ever being caught. Amaru can be the element of surprise as she can get downstairs with her Garra hook, but does not forget the point of the game is shooting well. Kali’s explosive spears are excellent when you want to destroy barricades from an entire room.

For defenders, Mozzie will be a nightmare for opponents who rely on their tech a little too much as his parasites will be able to capture opposing drones. Warden can snipe at long range quite easily, and is hard to take by surprise as he is immune to being Stunned or Located. Wamai can forbid thrown gadgets to be used with his Mag-net system. Goyo deploys Volcán Shields. When destroyed, those explode into a fire, halting the opponent’s progression, and potentially dealing some damage.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 6: Siege Concrete City
boardgame.description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege. Gameplay is fast and frenetic, allowing players to feel the tension of a cinematic assault with simulated real-time gameplay. Players control a team of 5 operators (all attackers or all defenders), with each Operator boasting different gadgets and abilities. Building your team of 5 is a very rewarding step of the game, offering endless possibilities and strategic choices. As the attacker, you will use your explosive arsenal to tear down walls and obstacles to reach your objective! As the defender, you will shape the battleground to your advantage and seek to thwart your opponent’s plans by denying them chances to attack.

"Map pack 1: Concrete City has the Bank and Kafé maps. Bank is all about a claustrophobic and failsafe environment that protects defenders. However, as soon as attackers breach a few walls and get into the thick of the action… they can benefit from it as well. Kafé is quite the opposite: open, with a lot of destructible terrain. No one is safe there. The defenders will need to be nimble, and can’t rely on a shield wall, since it’s so difficult to hold a position. Of course it will come with a dedicated mission booklet for these maps.

—description from the publisher"

boardgame.name: 6: Siege Dead End
boardgame.description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege. Gameplay is fast and frenetic, allowing players to feel the tension of a cinematic assault with simulated real-time gameplay. Players control a team of 5 operators (all attackers or all defenders), with each Operator boasting different gadgets and abilities. Building your team of 5 is a very rewarding step of the game, offering endless possibilities and strategic choices. As the attacker, you will use your explosive arsenal to tear down walls and obstacles to reach your objective! As the defender, you will shape the battleground to your advantage and seek to thwart your opponent’s plans by denying them chances to attack.

"Map Pack 2: Dead End, contains two more maps, Oregon and Chalet. Oregon is very open, with long hallways. It enables the most nimble Operators to make the most tactical plays, and that will force you to always think one step ahead. Oregon also has a lot of sniping spots, so… beware.

Chalet keeps Operators on their toes as no place is 100% safe. It is also quite vertical, and movement becomes even more tactical!

—description from the publisher

There is a darkness rising in the Marvel Universe! Legendary: Dark City, the first expansion to “Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game,” brings an entirely new level of play to the critically-acclaimed card game. We could not leave our heroes to try and fight their battles in a mess... So here is the Legendary Expansion Insert to neatly organize all your cards even if they are premium sleeved!

boardgame.name: Steel Division: Normandy 44 Second Wave
boardgame.description:
Second Wave is the first Division Pack for Steel Division: Normandy 44, expanding your tactical possibilities to dominate your enemy during the Invasion of Normandy. Take control of 4 new divisions : The American 4th Armored, the British Commando Brigade, the 9. Panzerdivision and the 16.Luftwaffe, each one of them designed to bring new flavour to the game.

Lead 35 new units into the battle, including the famous M18 Hellcat tank destroyer. Use the new Storch aerial artillery observer to spot your enemy and unleash hell on his units.

Second Wave also includes an exclusive cosmetic Ace: the Lieutenant-Colonel Creighton Williams Abrams and his famous M4(75) command tank.

The divisions in Second Wave are made up of new units, paired with existing ones from the base game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

Steel Division: Normandy 44 -Back to Hell features first-ever cooperative play and seven new historical missions (including five in co-op and multiplayer) based on real-world operations, where you get to play as 11 never before seen divisions in new historically accurate battles like Operation Windsor and Operation Bluecoat. The DLC also adds four new divisions, 58 new units, and two new exclusive Aces.

boardgame.name: Raccoon Robbers
boardgame.description:
The raccoons have organized into gangs, and each raccoon gang boss in Raccoon Robbers wants to be the first to reach the famous golden rubbish bin that's filled with endless amounts of thrown-away food.

The playing area is set up by individual pieces that represent the fields to which the raccoons can move — but only one raccoon can stay on a field, and it will throw other player's figures down to lower places. With hand cards that allow their own raccoons to climb up or down, each player can try to throw down other raccoons, move their own up, or climb down by free will before they get thrown by others.

Thanks to the flexible set-up, each game can played differently with various difficulty.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bubble Trouble
boardgame.description:
The sea creatures play hide and seek at the coral reef, not thinking of the deep chasm nearby where the dreaded shark dwells. Oh no, the ever-curious seahorse is swimming towards the shark's chasm! Bring it back to the reef with the help of the bubbly bubbles from the bubble anemone!

In Bubble Trouble, all players work together to try to bring as many sea creatures as possible back to the reef. To achieve this, they have to skillfully throw bubbles from the reef towards the sea creatures. All animals that are caught by a bubble drift one step closer to the reef; all animals not caught by a bubble swim further towards the shark. Once no more animals are in the playing area, the game ends and the players receive points for all the animals they rescued.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Happy Hopping
boardgame.description:
What a hustle and bustle! In Happy Hopping, the frogs jump into the ponds left and right. Everyone is on the hunt for colorful mosquitoes. Whose frogs can catch the most of them?

Over the course of eight rounds, the players try to complete tasks to collect chips. There are speed rounds, in which you need to be quicker than the other players, and normal rounds, in which all frogs may perform one jump. If the goal of a round is met, players gain frog chips – with the fastest players gaining a ladybug chip on top. They show mosquitoes in different colors. After the last round, a scoring tile determines which mosquito color scores points. Whoever has the most mosquitoes of that color, wins.

Happy Hopping cleverly integrates the game box into the game and jumping aids makes it easier for younger players to perform good jumps.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Midnight Market
boardgame.description:
The Midnight Market is finally taking place again! But only adult wizards and ghosts are allowed to visit. Bad luck for the students from the nearby school for magic because it is the only place to buy wonderful delicacies and magical pets. You can even find the rare Vanishing Stars there. Ghosts use them to make themselves invisible. "I would love to make myself invisible too!", says Anna. Amir has an ingenious idea: “We could just dress as ghosts to sneak onto the market and mingle with the visitors!” The others think it is a great plan. “This way, we won’t stand out. Maybe we can get hold of these Vanishing Stars? We can pull a lot of pranks with those!” The students create teams of four and off they go.

In Midnight Market each player receives a team marker showing the associated students who have disguised themselves as fake ghosts and the team number. These numbers can be found on the bottom of the ghost figures, but they still secret at the beginning of the game. With the help of a color die, the ghost figures can be moved across the playing fields of the market. If two ghosts meet at a booth, the player who moved the second ghost receives one or two magical chips. In addition, chips are given to those players whose team the ghosts belong to. It is therefore worthwhile to keep in mind all the numbers that are revealed over the course of the game – not so easy when the ghosts are constantly on the move!

Midnight Market expands the popular wizarding world of Wizardry to the power of three, Fabulantica, Mary Magica and Hexenhochhaus. The ghostly memory game includes a three-part scoring so that more than one person can win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sehrohr auf!
boardgame.description:
The playing field is put into a plastic frame and placed on edge. Each player equips the field on his side with ships, which are inserted into the holes in the playing field. An opaque plastic sheet between the layers of the playing field makes it impossible to see the opposing ship positions. At the bottom of the playing field a "periscope" is hooked, with which one can spy out the opponent's side of the playing field under limited conditions. The goal is to remove the enemy ships from their position with the help of torpedoes and depth charges. These are inserted into a hole on your own side and push out the enemy ship on the opposite side.
The winner is the player who is the last to have his own ships left in the playing field.

—user summary

boardgame.name: hoch3
boardgame.description:
The game board shows 9 fields on which the game pieces are placed and moved. In the 2-person game, the game is played on the five central squares of the game board. Each player receives 6 discs in his color and tries to form a tower of three in his own color as quickly as possible.
The active player places a piece on a square. The players take turns until all the pieces are on the board. Pieces in a field are stacked to form towers. Each tower can consist of a maximum of three pieces.
When all pieces are in play, the active player may always take one of his own free pieces and place it on another square. However, pieces blocked by other pieces are taboo. If none of a player's pieces is free, that player must sit out a round.
End of game: As soon as a player succeeds in forming a tower of three of his own pieces, he has won the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: (The Wandering Earth: Road to Survival)

In Wandering Earth: Road to Survival, as a team leader, you need to be vigilant at all times, check detector data, deploy your team, find ways to protect your team members, and bring them to the nearest bunker entrance as soon as possible.

The great changes in civilization brought about by the disaster have caused tremendous changes in the thinking of the leaders. Everyone has a secret mission of their own in their hearts, which will affect every judgment they make during the evacuation process.

Quran Challenge Game: The world of the Quran in one box
boardgame.description:
The Quran Challenge Game for children is a unique game based on the Holy Quran.

The idea behind this game is to provide the children with both fun and education.
All questions are taken from the Quran.
They have been creatively worked into this game and children will enjoy answering them.
This game can be played at school or at home with all the family members.
Begin your journey and find out what fun it is to learn from the Quran.

The player to reach the Finnish space first is the winner.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kozmik Objects & Entities
boardgame.description: Kozmik Objects & Entities is a zine (that means a small book) featuring places and beings that adventurers can encounter in Deep Space! A garden asteroid, an abandoned space station, a black hole trading port, a sentient nebula, feuding space cults, and more! This system-neutral zine is meant to be used with the space-faring tabletop RPG of your choice. Games like ITLOAGS, Troika, Offworlders, Mothership, Solar Blades & Cosmic Spells, and Space Goblins.

boardgame.name: Coalitions: Ancien Rgime Expansion
boardgame.description:
Europe is in turmoil! The emerging Prussian Kingdom under Frederick the Great moves to expand and consolidate its power at the cost of Austria while the Franco-British struggle for global primacy has already engulfed Spain and leads both nations to seek new allies on the Old Continent. Will Russia and the Ottoman Empire, two seemingly disinterested parties, continue to watch from afar or will they join in this struggle for the dominance of Europe?

Ancien Régime is a major expansion for Coalitions, a game of negotiation and alliance-building for control of Europe. It comes with a new distinct game board, a 7th playable nation (Spain), and a variety of new components and mechanisms. This is not a standalone expansion; it requires some components from the Coalitions core box.
Up to 7 players engage in an exciting area control game of shifting alliances and coalitions, of intense back-stabbing diplomacy and bold military actions set in an era defined by the immense Seven Years’ War.
Like in the Coalitions core game, the Ancien Régime Expansion uses the Wheel of War mechanic to make downtime non-existent, while the innovative Activator system introduces a new level of dynamic interactions between the players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game Zeo: Stronger Than Before
boardgame.description:
Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game – Zeo: Stronger Than Before is a competitive deck-building game that pits 1-2 heroes against 1-2 villains. In this asymmetrical game, the hero and villain sides play a bit differently, but in the end, they both have the same goal: Crush your enemies! This is playable as a standalone game or can be combined with the Power Rangers Deck-Building Game Core Set for even more possibilities!

During your turn, you play cards to generate shards and energy. You use shards to buy cards or battle adversaries and gain rewards. You can attack the opposing team using attack cards, and when you are attacked, you can defend with block cards. At the end of your turn, you perform any "end of turn" actions, discard cards played that turn, take one damage for each adversary in "The Grid", then refill your hand to five cards.

The first side to reduce their opponent's hit points to 0 wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Coalitions: Raison d'Etat Expansion
boardgame.description:
Europe is in turmoil! The fire of the Protestant Reformation has engulfed Central Europe, while the nascent Swedish Empire battles with the vast, populous and battle-ready Poland over the supremacy in the East and the Baltic Sea. Will the Holy Roman Emperor remain on his throne? Which side of this enormous conflict will the nations of Europe choose? And will Poland survive the Swedish deluge?

Raison d’Etat is a board game for 1-7 players. It is a standalone expansion for Coalitions, with its own distinct game board and seven playable nations (Poland, Sweden, Britain, France, Spain, Austria, and the Ottoman Empire) included in the box. Unlike other expansions for Coalitions, you do not need the base game of Coalitions to play Raison d’Etat. It comes with all the components, rules and scenarios necessary to play.

Players engage in an exciting area control game of shifting alliances and coalitions, of intense back-stabbing, diplomacy and bold military actions set in an era defined by the upheaval of the Thirty Years’ War and the Polish-Swedish Wars. As in the Coalitions’ core game, Raison d'Etat’s uses the Wheel of War mechanic to virtually eliminate downtime, while the innovative Activator system introduces a new level of dynamic interactions between the players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Stealing the Throne - Core Rules
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

A thousand years ago, we built twelve giant mecha to fight a cataclysmic war. We called them Thrones. Ten survived that great war: ancient weapons with storied histories of battle and betrayal, but also symbols of dominance and entitlement. Possession of a Throne bestows wealth, power, and dominion over whole star systems.

That's why you're going to steal one.

Stealing the Throne is a tabletop roleplaying game of exciting mecha heist action for 3-5 players. It’s GMless, and requires absolutely zero prep to play. In just a few hours you’ll build a Throne, a titanic mech with a thousand years of drama-filled history. You’ll devise the elaborate security systems that protect it, and then play to find out how your crew of thieves take them apart.

A mecha heist rpg / 3-5 players / GMless / 1-3 hours / zero-prep

boardgame.name: Richard Simmons Sweat & Shout Party Game
boardgame.description:
In this fun, fast party game, players choose a unique action (Sweat) and saying (Shout) based on the chosen Topic Card - you'll need to remember your opponents' actions too!
Flip your cards over, and watch for matches - if you match an opponent, you need to do their move first to win the card!
Keep an eye out for objects matching the Slap Card...if you slap it first, you get the Fitness Instructor Sweatband, and can make your opponents SWEAT!
Be the player with the most victory cards at the end to win

boardgame.name: Corpo D'Armata
boardgame.description:
Corpo D'Armata, Army Corps is a miniature rulebook coming from Napoleonic battles wargame experiences that have matured over many years.

These rules try to reproduce a battle or a campaign respecting the historical conditions as much as possible, such as the number and quality of troops, resources and means available to the various European armies. Trying to achieve the set objectives and reproducing the strategic and tactical choices of the commanders of the time.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Imperi e Feudi: Terza espansione geografica Bisanzio, il Medio Oriente e le Crociate
boardgame.description:
Imperi e Feudi: Terza espansione geografica – Bisanzio, il Medio Oriente e le Crociate, Empires and Feuds - Third geographical expansion: Byzantium, the Middle East and the Crusades

This third expansion of Imperi e Feudi allows you to play with the armies that fought in the near east in the great medieval battles.
In this volume you will find:

25 new Army Lists,
rules to introduce "Historical Commanders", playable cards of the "Historical Commanders" with their personal characteristics,
optional rules,
motion rulers and range devices for shooting weapons.


This volume does not contain the rules, in order to play it is necessary possess the basic rules Imperi e Feudi.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: I Leoni delle Ambe
boardgame.description:
I Leoni delle Ambe, The Lion of the Ambe

The rules are intended to represent combats in the colonial era, conducted by the Italian Royal Army in East Africa (1880-1900).

This is a Brigade / Division level tactical game.
Units are at the level of Infantry Battalion, Cavalry Regiment or Artillery Group.

It is recommended for 15-20mm figures.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: MYTH Trading Card Game
boardgame.description:
A fantasy-style trading card game in which the players (dubbed MYTH Commanders) deploy Creatures, cast Sorcery, equip weapons, and change field conditions in order to attack the other Commander's Fortress. A Fortress consists of three Towers, each with 200 hit points, or Wall Points. The first player to bring their opponent's Towers to 0 Wall Points each has breached the Fortress and won the game.

Commanders deploy Creatures as their main attack force, each with a set of Attack Points, Guard Points, and Health Points. Creatures attack each other by comparing Attack Points to Guard Points, and the difference is dealt as damage to the weaker Creature's Health Points. Creatures are placed on a Battlefield, a 3-by-2 grid that allows or restricts attacks depending on placement. A Creature that has not been deployed the same turn, occupies a certain space on the Battlefield, and has no opposing Creatures directly in front of it, has a chance to directly attack the opposing Towers.

Commanders change the flow of the game with Sorcery cards, each with its own category and level that dictates their effectiveness. Commanders equip weaponry in the form of Armory cards to their Creatures, modifying their effectiveness in the game. And Commanders change field conditions with Field cards, granting advantages and disadvantages to Creatures depending on a variety of stats and classifications.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mayhem-Museum Map Pack
boardgame.description:
Publisher's description:

These are the maps for the Mayhem-Museum adventures set-up in full-color to be printed off on 11"x17" stock.

boardgame.name: Darker Forts
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Your name is Klort.

User summary:

Darker Forts presents three scenarios:

The Mansion of Doom
The Grimeful City
The Defiled Temple


The scenarios are randomly generated and have high replay value.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Potion Description Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This roleplaying tool gives you billions of different possible combinations that can be easily applied to any potion, elixir, poison, drug, or concoction found in a fantasy world. System agnostic by design, this tool can be applied to any fantasy world you choose.

This set of tables will tell you a potion’s color, flavor, scent, texture, and even signs of it’s mystic energy matrix. This tool also helps you define the container, and even side effects associated with the mystic draught. While the potions and elixirs can make interesting treasure or plot devices, this tool is as flexible as you are. Use only the tables you want when you want, since we won’t ask that any Dungeon Master or referee jump through hoops to use our products.

boardgame.name: 100 Spaceship Quirks - Vol 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Spaceships are like special homes for a crew that can last for decades at a time. And all good captains quickly learn to alter their ship to fit their particular needs, personality and aesthetic. And over time, these choices can alter the very programming and infrastructure of any space vessel. For better or worse.

boardgame.name: Cyber City Gang Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This roleplaying tool gives you millions of different possible combinations to make up new gangs for your cyberpunk campaign.

boardgame.name: Cyber City Underworld Clinic Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This roleplaying tool gives you millions of different possible combinations to make up new and different illegal and/or non-registered medical clinics for your cyberpunk campaign.

boardgame.name: 100 Pony Companions Vol 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ponies provide a sense of primordial power and motion to the world. So why not take the utmost advantage of that sensation in your fantasy or Wild west game? Shouldn't your steed be more than a pile of numbers with no real appearance, personality or spirit?

boardgame.name: Wild West Soiled Dove Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Soiled doves, saloon girls, ladies of the evening, and many other names have been used to describe practitioners of what is known as the oldest profession: prostitution. In the wild west they can be found in all kinds of bordellos, brothels, houses of ill repute, opium dens, hotels, tents, and saloons. Their lives were colorful if not socially acceptable, as they struggled to find a place and a home in the new frontier.

boardgame.name: Roaring 20s Speakeasy Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Speakeasy is a term for an illegal bar or restaurant that sold alcohol between 1920 and 1933 (the time of prohibition). The speakeasy helped to change the United States by ushering in the notion of dating, mixing the races and sexes over drinks, and a new sense of lawlessness into the country. Many cities had thousands of speakeasies during prohibition, and each could become a place of intrigue, conflict, romance, and adventure.

boardgame.name: Jun 26, 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Forest Clearing Campsite (Day/Night Versions)

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Magical Lighthouse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 559th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a magical light used as a lighthouse on a small island.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Inn Dolo Delicto
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Mid-Level Fantasy Adventure for Player Levels 5 to 7

The bountiful Oliva valley boasts two famous hostelries run by the Fiore Twins.

The Inns are the pride of Fidelis Province, but the wilds are a dangerous place.

A pack of shapshifters has assailed the Luna Inn and taken Rabbina Riore hostage.

Her sister Camino has hired you to rescue her; can you unmask her captors?
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Azukail Games March 2021 Newsletter
boardgame.description: This newsletter has an update on the products releasing in March 2021.

boardgame.name: Azukail Games April 2021 Newsletter
boardgame.description: This newsletter has an update on the products releasing in April 2021.

boardgame.name: Azukail Games May 2021 Newsletter
boardgame.description: This newsletter has an update on the products releasing in May 2021.
