boardgame.description: This newsletter has an update on the products releasing in June 2021.

boardgame.name: Azukail Games July 2021 Newsletter
boardgame.description: This newsletter has an update on the products releasing in July 2021.

boardgame.name: Bexim's Bazaar (Issue #31 - Jul 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bexim’s Bazaar is a monthly gaming magazine dedicated to RPGs and wargames… and occasionally a boardgame of interest to RPG/wargamers. GMs and players will find plenty of resources such as magic item cards, random tables, mini-adventures, and articles related to gaming as well as printable props to hand out in game. This issue contains over 80 pages of gaming content for a variety of genres and games, and gamers are welcome to submit their own content for future issues.

boardgame.name: The Last Oricru
boardgame.description:
The Last Oricru is an action-RPG with a strong emphasis on dynamic storytelling and player choice. Waking up in the living and breathing sci-fi/medieval world of Wardenia, players find themselves in the middle of a massive civil war over supremacy on the planet. Intense combat, massive battles and a dark conspiracy overshadow the once peaceful world. Choose your own path, side with the different factions and influence the outcome of the war in this choice-driven experience. The Last Oricru is designed as both a single-player and a local co-op experience.

Players take on the role of Silver, a man who crash-landed years ago on this mysterious planet, just to be suddenly waken up from his cryochamber. The mystery of Silver’s role in the story will unfold as players begin to learn more about him as they journey through Wardenia with him.

boardgame.name: Crush the Kaiser: Where the Poppies Grow Fast play wargames rules for the Western Front 1916 to 1918
boardgame.description:
Where the Poppies Grow covers the Western Front from 1916 to 1918.
Includes rules for using tanks and aircraft, as well as varied artillery barrages and counter-battery fire, gas, mines and stormtroopers.


Fast play battalion and brigade level rules designed by wargamers, for wargamers
Fully researched and historically accurate for the period
Detailed organisations for all the armies on the Western Front 14-18
Rules are scenario based not points driven
Suitable for all figure scales, no need to re-base your figures
Company or squadron are smallest units for infantry and cavalry, with a company typically having 14 figures
Rules are written in order of play, so no need to flip back and forth through a book, with examples running through the rules
Minimum number of dice rolls for casualties
Four different experience levels for troops from Raw to Veteran, which determines how they shoot and react.
Simple and effective mechanisms for morale at company level, with more detailed battalion level morale only needed if losses are high


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Crush the Kaiser: Over by Christmas
Crush the Kaiser: Tools of victory

boardgame.name: Crush the Kaiser: Tools of victory
boardgame.description:
Expansion for for Crush the Kaiser, Tools of Victory has detailed battalion and brigade organisations for infantry, cavalry and artillery for the armies that fought on the Western Front from 1916 onwards.

These include British and Empire, French and German and also US, Belgian, Portuguese, Austro-Hungarians and the Russian Expeditionary Corps.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Crush the Kaiser: Where the Poppies Grow Fast play wargames rules for the Western Front 1916 to 1918

boardgame.name: Crush the Kaiser: Over by Christmas
boardgame.description:
Over by Christmas covers the early part of the Great War on the Western Front from August 1914 to early 1916, and includes detailed organizations for the British, French, Belgian and German armies.

Allows you to fight fast moving open warfare with cavalry charges and horse artillery as well as the beginnings of the trench war.

Lots of period flavour including improvised grenades and mortars, trench catapults, rapid fire by British Regulars and attaque à outrance by French infantry.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Crush the Kaiser: Where the Poppies Grow Fast play wargames rules for the Western Front 1916 to 1918

boardgame.name: Crush the Kaiser: Achtung Gringo
boardgame.description:
Achtung Gringo Fast play rules for wargaming the Mexican revolution from 1910 to 1920 plus some interesting What if options!

Fast & easy to Play, Battalion or regimental levels, organisations for Federals and revolutionaries, Pershing expedition, Villa and Zapata, plus organisation for the German led invasion of the southern USA!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Martyr: Bloody Theater 1528
boardgame.description:
Those criminals are being called “Heretics!” “Enemies of the Government!” “Messengers of the Antichrist!” And you're compelled to join them.

Europe, early 1500s. Now, the State Church has determined that you, too, deserve a terminal sentence for committing multiple crimes – that is, what they have decided are crimes.

But you are scheming to seize a rare opportunity: To use your final act to subvert the State Church’s effort towards full governmental supremacy. Armed only with a message and your final breaths, can you use them shrewdly in the ultimate performance of your life?

In Martyr: Bloody Theater 1528, you will push your luck with your dwindling breaths to shape public opinion through action selection, while controlling the advantage, or disadvantage, of player turn order. But stay focused, because as you incentivize other players to aid your cause, you may also be delivering them to victory…

Contend valiantly!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Godtear: Helena, Inspiration of Hope & Rallied Peasants
boardgame.description:
Raise your banner with Helena, the Inspiration of Hope.

Pure of heart, beloved Helena strides into battle with a message not of conquest, but of unity. Wherever this sacred quest takes her, Rallied Peasants flock to her standard in hope of a better world.

Introducing the ONLY Guardian champion without a banner! So devoted is she to her cause that Helena embodies her own banner—her presence alone is enough to stake her claim on the battlefield.

Inside this box is everything you need to add this inspiring champion to your Godtear warband. Use this expansion with any Godtear starter set.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sorry!: Rivals Edition
boardgame.description:
A rivalry twist on the classic game Sorry! This dual game has more chaos and frustration than it’s original. Try beating your opponent by getting your pawns home first, but count on being sent back to “start” more times than you can count.

You start with five cards in hand and every time you play a card you pick up a new one. Similar to the original game, cards signify how many spaces you can move on the board.

Players move clockwise from “start” trying to get “home”. The board contains slides based on color to move you around the board faster.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dekoder
boardgame.description:
A 1-5 players logic game, where all the players lay rectangle tiles with 2 digits and 2 colours on a square common board.
When you lay a tile you count all the tile's squares on the board in the same rows and columns as the tile you just put - that's the number of points you get.

But there is a restriction - no colour and no digit can appear in a row or column more than once - similarly to Sudoku.
You can also put tiles on top of other tiles. That gives extra 5 points, but there are 4 conditions to be met:

there must be at least 5 tiles on the board
your tile must cover two squares of two separate tiles
you can't cover the same digits and colours as the ones on your tile
both tiles you cover need to be on the same level


—user summary

Wyjtkowa gra logiczna, oparta na ukadaniu szyfrów na planszy w taki sposób, eby powstay niepowtarzalne ukady. Osiem cyfr i osiem kolorów – aden nie moe pojawi si wicej ni raz w rzdzie lub kolumnie na siatce planszy. Im sprawniej bdziesz kodowa, tym wicej zgarniesz punków i tym szybciej wykonasz zadanie. Czy uda Ci si zama szyfr i zgarn laur zwycistwa?

—description from the publisher

Unique logic game about laying unique cipher patterns. 8 digits and 8 colours - none can appear more than once in any row or column on the board. The better you code, the more points you get and reach the goal faster. Are you able to break the code and claim the victory?

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Tholos
boardgame.description:
Participate in the construction of the Tholos of Delphi, the temple that marks the center of the universe marked by Zeus and built inside the Sanctuary of Athena Pronaia. As a builder, face your opponent in a duel and achieve the greatest influence within its sacred construction. May the gods be propitious to you!

Tholos is a game of majorities for two players with high interaction. On a turn, you take one of two actions:


Take stones of one color from the quarry into your workshop, with each workshop holding at most three stones. You can take up to three stones of your color (black/white), up to two neutral stones (gray), or one stone of your opponent (white/black).
Play any stone from your workshop onto the game board. The board has seven locations, each with a unique power, and each location can have a column of at most five stones. If you place a stone of your color in a location, then you take the special action associated with that location, e.g., moving the top stone of a column to another location, moving a stone from the opponent's workshop to your workshop, placing a second stone from your workshop, or returning a played stone to the quarry.


When all seven columns have five stones on them, the game ends and players receive points for each column where they have more stones than the opponent — but this isn't necessarily a good thing. When you score a column, you receive 1 point for each stone of your color, 3 points for each stone of the opposing color, and -2 points for each neutral stone. each column awards points to the player who has the most stones of their color in that column.

In the advanced mode of Tholos, you place one or more ornament tiles on the game board, each in a different location. Each ornament tile has a power that changes the rules of the game, such as activating the power of a location with gray stones, awarding a column to the player with fewer stones than the opponent, or raising the maximum number of stones in the location's column to seven.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: Canine Capers
boardgame.description:
In Canine Capers you play as a determined dog who is investigating their neighbourhood, sniffing out clues and to solve the imagined capers going on in their little country village. Work together to reach clues in time and secure them at Canine P.D. to earn points and solve the caper of the day.

Clues will pop up around the village based on the outcomes of dice rolls. Players roll dice to determine their 'paw points' for that turn. Using these they traverse the board, pick up, drop off, give, take clues and even increase the value of their clues.

It's a race to get to clues before a new one would be generate in that spot as if the previous clue is still on the board the new clue will be stolen by a sneaky cat and taken away to their toy chest. Not to worry, with a bit of help from the sly foxes on the board you can enhance other clues by swapping them with higher value clues from the toy chest.

Special Actions linked to each number on the die allow players extra abilities that can allow for diagonal movement, enhance clues, move a clue, jump to home, swap two clues on the board or return clues to the resource pool, which can extend your playing time as once the resource pools are empty it's time to take your final turn then tally up your points to see if you've won this time!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Animal Alliance
boardgame.description:
In Animal Alliance felines are doing their felonious best to steal toys and canines are returning toys to the lost and found. The twist is each player takes control of a cat and dog team who live in the same house, they have different goals but a combined score.

Players roll 2 dice and assign one to their cat and another to their dog for that turn (purr points and paw points). Using these they traverse the board, pick up, drop off, give and take toys, steal toys from other pets and even increase the value of their toys. Whenever a pet tries to steal from another, dice are rolled to determine the 'reflexes' and 'stealth' for each to determine whether the theft was successful or not.

Special Actions linked to each number on the die allow players extra abilities which are slightly different for the cats and dogs so pay close attention when assigning your dice to each pet. Special Actions can allow diagonal movement, move toys on the board, add new toys to the board, increase or decrease the value of toys by flipping the token or take a cat nap to save Purr Points for use later in the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Feline Felonies
boardgame.description:
In Feline Felonies you take charge of a neighbourhood cat whose goal is to be the greatest thief around. You’ll steal toys and other items cats believe to be toys from around the board as well as from other cats. Get the most highly valued toys home to win and be crowned most felonious of the felines.

Players roll dice to determine their 'Purr Points' for each turn. Using these they traverse the board, pick up and drop off toys, steal toys from other cats and even increase the value of their toys. Whenever a cat tries to steal from another, dice are rolled to determine the 'reflexes' and 'stealth' for each to determine whether the theft was successful or not.

Special Actions linked to each number on the die allow players to move toys on the board, add new toys to the board, increase or decrease the value of toys by flipping the token or take a cat nap to save Purr Points for use later in the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Unfinishabell
boardgame.description:
Take turns placing a card on the left or right of an ever-growing line. The line must always be a potential word, but if you ever finish the word, your opponent wins a point!

Similarly, if you ever place a card so that no potential word can be made (and your opponent challenges), they win a point.

Each round starts with a tricky attempt to avoid making tiny words, and then usually finishes when you run out of long words to make given the cards played.

Played using the ELL deck (which has 2 letter on each card).

boardgame.name: The Vampires
boardgame.description:
As a vampire hunter, you are called upon to Transylvania to battle the most feared mythical creatures who live there!

The game starts by giving each player 5 cards, and placing 4 vampire cards face up in the middle of the table.
On your turn, you play a card with the matching color next to a vampire, and when a vampire already has 4 matching cards next to it, you can defeat it by playing the corresponding weapon.
Some of the cards allow you to take actions:

Garlic cards cause the next player to miss a turn
Mirror cards allow you to swap your remaining cards with another player
Coffin cards will wake up a new vampire
Bite cards remove all cards lying around a vampire


When defeating a vampire, the person who played the weapon collects the vampire card, and gains the 1-4 points shown on him. The first player to collect 6 points will be declared the terror of all vampires!
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 5 Seasons Best Portuguese Filler Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Flick the Ship
boardgame.description:
Flick the Ship is a turn-based pencil-and-paper naval warfare game where 2-4 players use their skill in flicking a pencil across paper to fight each other, sea monsters, and sometimes even the seascape itself.

Players collect experience points to level up their vessel, and can forge alliances with other ships to make massive fleets. By collecting gold doubloons, additional "mini-ships" can be bought for more casual, low-stakes play.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ganga: River Rescue
boardgame.description:
A thrilling chain building game exploring river water conservation, history & geography affecting India's divine river, Ganga.

You are in a race to save the Ganga ecosystem from extinction and loss. The crops, trees, birds and animals depend on you to rescue them from pollution, pandemics and over population. It is a race to save the cities in the Indo-Gangetic Plains Ecosystem through which the mighty river Ganga flows. She is not an ordinary river, but a Goddess of the Land.

Life is simple. Build your Living Unit chains, preserve your River cards, collect Goals and keep an eye on the competition. You probably have that secret smile knowing you are making a difference to our ecosystem. Knowledge will lead to action and nothing like a game to help you forge forward. Laugh a lot, compete fiercely and resolve to make a difference.

The Game ends when 4 Events have occurred or all the cards run out. Player wins by collecting Goals achieved of a collection of Living Units.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Swar1 (Issue 11 - Spring 1993)
boardgame.description: Swar1• #11 contains various articles, partly humorous. There's also a campaign framework based on the Ancient Egyptian myth of Isis and Osiris.

boardgame.name: Swar1 (Issue 14 - Winter 1994/ Spring 1995)
boardgame.description:
This is the sixth and final issue of Swar1•. It contains an introduction to the internet (DFÜ, Datenfernübertragung), prints some tidbits from usenet messageboards (Nachrichten-Bretter), has an article about Erzählspiele, a description of a religion (Kelch der Seelen), a poem from 1805 about the political situation in Europe, an article about how tabletop roleplaying is mis-represented in the media, combined with a more level-headed description aimed at outsiders.

Last but not least the issue contains the chamber larp "Liebeszauber".

boardgame.name: Jaws: No swimming, beach closed
boardgame.description:
The vessel 'Orca' roams the waters to hunt Jaws...and a shark fun has been sighted. BEACH CLOSED!

The great white creeps under the surface looking for a meal, and three innocent swimmers are still in the water! The Orca and Jaws constantly try to outrun and outsmart each other by using hidden movement and deploying extra skills.

But do not hesitate, because the playing area gets smaller and smaller each turn!

—description from the publisher

First Jaws gets a full turn by moving, taking one action (and maybe use tokens), and removing a card.
Then all the other players get their full turn by moving, taking one action, and removing a card.
If the person playing as Jaws manages to eat the three swimmers, they win the game. If the player(s) who are on the boat manage to hit Jaws three times, they win the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Hentai Honeys Jigsaw
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Four puzzles with hentai images. More puzzles can be purchased as expansions. The puzzles are 3x3 to 5x5 tiles.

boardgame.name: Hentai Honeys Jigsaw - Geisya
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Additional 12 puzzles for Hentai Honeys Jigsaw with levels from 3x3 to 6x6 tiles.

These puzzles contains drawings of women wearing open kimonos.

boardgame.name: Hentai Honeys Jigsaw - Wife
boardgame.description:
User Summary

12 additional puzzles for Hentai Honeys Jigsaw featuring married women. The difficulty is 3x3 to 6x6 tiles.

boardgame.name: Hentai Honeys Jigsaw - Wife2
boardgame.description:
User Summary

12 additional puzzles for Hentai Honeys Jigsaw featuring married women. The difficulty is 3x3 to 10x10 tiles.

boardgame.name: Unfair Expansion: Comicbook Hacker Kaiju Ocean
boardgame.description:
Build the city's greatest theme park, whatever it takes, with more themes now available in the Unfair Expansion: Comicbook Hacker Kaiju Ocean. These new themes can be mixed with old favorites and with each other:


Comicbook: Superheroes are among us! Masterminds, origin stories, super powers, secret identities ... and the occasional villainous monologue.
Hacker: What do you get when you mix a cyberpunk cityscape with skilled IT professionals, Wi-Fi for your guests, and a roving AI? There's only one way to find out!
Kaiju: Giant monsters, previously seen only in movies, now here to stomp around the Market. Help to defend a grateful City, or benefit from the chaos - it's lucrative either way!
Ocean: The ocean gives us amazing creatures, rich resources, a wealth of fabulous natural treasures. And seagulls.


You can also tailor the game to suit your preferred play style with new game changer cards.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Jetzt mal ehrlich!
boardgame.description:
With the help of an enclosed lie detector, yes/no answers of the players to juicy questions are checked. The player who tells the truth and exposes the other players' lies wins points. The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Pie Face Wolkenklatscher!
boardgame.description:
As a variation to the Pie Face game, here the "pie throw" is triggered by a different mechanism. A hammer is used to hit a trigger that flings a weight upwards. When the weight reaches the pie thrower, there is the pie throw simulated with spray foam.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Sims 4 - Cottage Living
boardgame.description:
Delight in the quaint charm of The Sims™ 4 Cottage Living Expansion Pack* with animal friends, garden-to-table meals, and a close-knit community. Explore the forest to befriend woodland creatures, or head to town to meet the locals. Whether Sims are hugging a cow, making friends (or enemies) with their chickens, or growing the biggest vegetables around, the countryside presents abundant new ways to reconnect with the world.

KEY FEATURES

Gnomeful Exclusives — We are ALL about the Gnomes, and even more have managed to sneak into the game for those who purchase by September 2! Ride around town with the Scenic Commuting Bicycle, make a statement with the "Onward" The Adventurous Gnome sculpture, and delight your Lot with the Bramblewood's DeLIGHTful Tree. (Don’t worry about the tiny door in the trunk. It’s fine. We promise.)

Raise or Befriend Animals — The cottage cow provides fresh (flavored!) milk while chickens lay eggs in the coop. Beware of mischievous foxes—the pesky critters love eggs! In the forest, look out for wild rabbits and birds. Earn their trust for occasional gifts and help in the garden.

Live Off the Land — New recipes and Lot Challenges require fresh ingredients for each meal, and now kids can help in the kitchen and garden. Grow produce together, visit the village market, or forage in the wild for ingredients. Got oversized crops? Enter them in competition at the Finchwick Fair!

Embrace Village Life — Henford-on-Bagley is a cozy place where everyone knows everyone. So pack a picnic basket and cross-stitch hoop, and head down to the pub to hang with the locals. Learn about the town’s lore from neighbors for fun surprises.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: 16.12.1971: Swarnim Vijay Varsh
boardgame.description:
Swarnim Vijay Varsh

On 16th December 1971, the Indian Armed Forces secured a decisive and historic Victory over Pakistan Army, which led to the creation of a Nation - Bangladesh and also resulted in the largest Military Surrender after the World War - II.
Vijay Diwas is celebrated every year on December 16 to mark India’s triumph in liberating Bangladesh from Pakistan in 1971. In one of the fastest and shortest campaigns of military history, a new nation was born as a result of the swift campaign undertaken by the Indian Armed forces. To commemorate this victory, from 16 December 2020, the Nation is celebrating 50 Years of India-Pak War, also called ‘Swarnim Vijay Varsh’.

About the Game

16.12.1971 – Is a war game designed to commemorate 50 years of India’s victory over Pakistan. Swarnim Vijay Varsh is being celebrated and we have designed it with a total of 50 spaces (50th Anniversary) in the game board.
The name of the game 16.12.1971 indicates: -
16 – Total hours taken by us to plan, design, conceptualize, play test and complete!!
12 – Number of Assets and Number of Targets in the game
1 – One Board
9 – Number of Challenges / Actions confronted by players / Force
7 – Number of Joint operations planned in the game
1 – One Dice

Rules & Regulations:
The Print & play game consist of three forces – Army, Navy and Airforce each with 4 assets. Each force will be navigated by three players by rolling the dice and get each of their assets(pawns), to reach the ‘KILL ZONE’. Once the asset is in Kill Zone, the player will Roll the dice, if lucky HE/SHE will hit the respective equivalent enemy force Target.

boardgame.name: Strasse frei!
boardgame.description:
9 game pieces in 4 colors (3* 2 and 1* 3) are placed as a square. In turn, each player rolls the color die once and removes a piece of the color rolled. If this figure no longer exists, or if he rolls black or white, nothing happens. The player who succeeds in clearing a row of 3 figures vertically, horizontally or diagonally wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Kim-Joy's Magic Bakery
boardgame.description:
Your favorite British Baker, Kim-Joy, has moved to a magical forest and opened up a small bakery. Now she needs your help to keep customers happy. From sly foxes to needy cats, gossipy ducks to clumsy dinosaurs, you’re about to have your hands full keeping this bakery running smoothly!

Kim-Joy’s Magic Bakery is a light cooperative card game for 2 to 5 players that tells an adorable story over 10 unique scenarios. No baking experience required!

Kim-Joy’s Magic Bakery is a cooperative baking card game in which you and your friends are working together to run a bakery in a magical forest. The goal of the game is to bake as many treats as you can for your customers before the day ends and the customers leave. In game terms this means that you and your friends will have a limited number of actions to put together specific sets of ingredients and layers in order to bake increasingly complex treats for your customers.
The game takes place over a series of 10 scenarios that get progressively tougher. Each scenario adds a new challenge to the game that will force you to adapt and change your strategies. Every time you play, you can work your way through the Scenarios to experience the story, or you can play in freeplay mode to mix and match scenarios for the ultimate co-op baking challenge!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Versos Desencontrados: Alfonsina Storni
boardgame.description:
A poetic game to continue giving voice to Alfonsina Storni's work. You just have to mix and match to re-read and create.

Three forms of play: "disengaged verses", "creation of antisonetos" and "interleaved verses". The proposal invites you to play with the verses, read them, combine them and be encouraged to write.

boardgame.name: Desafo Vocablos
boardgame.description:
A creative game to make words by combining letters and syllables responding to different "challenges".

Three forms of play: "challenge", "challenge sung" and "challenge yourself". In all the modes you will have to find words, depending on the challenge, to get many points. It can also be played in solo mode.

boardgame.name: Invencin de Haikus
boardgame.description:
A creative game for writing Japanese poetry.
Go through the seasons of the year and put together a photograph made of words.

Divide the deck into 4. Each card you draw will guide you to write a haiku. In nature you will find the rest!

boardgame.name: Goldenstar: the Galactic Tournament
boardgame.description:
Goldenstar: The Galactic Tournament is a 2-4 players asymmetric, deck building, King of the Hill Board Game.

The Goldenstar Tournament is an event organized by Galactic Empress every 5 years to honor Goldenstar, her favourite buddy cop movie. Now the tournament gathers the most dangerous duos which come to fight for eternal glory and fame on arenas scattered around the galaxy.

Start with a deck combined of two challengers’ unique skill sets. Become crowd favorites, dominate your opponents and level-up characters. Upgrade your arsenal in Black Market and ultimately challenge everyone in THE FINAL FACE-OFF.

—description from the publisher

One player secretly moves around a grid, spelling words to take over a board.

The other player tries to work out where they are.

boardgame.name: Dice Miner Deluxe: Backer Pack
Dice Miner: Backer Pack Deluxe
boardgame.description:
The Dice Miner Deluxe: Backer Pack is a collection of components and extras delivered only to Kickstarter backers. The exact contents of the backer pack depend on which stretch goals are unlocked, as decided by you, the backers.

Contents:
- 6 x Extra Hero Cards
- 6 x Bonus Tunnel Dice
- 1 x Double-Sided Dry-Erase Score Sheet
- 1 x Dry-Erase Marker

"Adventuring Party" Play Mode: If six new heroes are unlocked, the "Adventuring Party" play mode will also be provided to all backers as a digital download. In this mode, each player gets three heroes per game, and uses a different one in each round.

Liquid Courage Dice Game: If five tunnel dice are unlocked, a brand new dice game called Liquid Courage will also be automatically unlocked, and provided to all backers as a digital download.

boardgame.name: Splinter
boardgame.description:
Splinter is an abstract strategy game for two players. The object of the game is to splinter your opponent’s king into a group that is smaller than your king’s group.

Play begins with 15 pieces per player (14 pawns and 1 king), arranged in a checkerboard pattern around the kings, which occupy the board's two central squares.

On your turn, you may slide one of your pieces (including your king or any of your pawns) one square in any direction (including diagonally), pushing along any pieces (including kings or pawns of either or both colors) that lie in the way (but not off the board).

A splinter occurs when one or more pieces become disconnected from the original group so that there are empty squares between those pieces and the original group. Following a splinter, any groups that do not contain a king are removed from the board.

If a splinter causes the kings to occupy two different groups, the game ends and the player whose king occupies the larger group wins (with pieces of both colors counting equally). If the two groups are of equal size, the player who has removed more opposing pawns wins. If both players have removed an equal number of pawns, the game ends in a tie.

Click here for official rules and diagrams: https://splinterboardgame.blogspot.com/2021/06/splinter-is-t...

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Wrecking Crew '98
boardgame.description:
Wrecking Crew '98 is an action puzzle game released exclusively in Japan in 1998 for the Super Famicom's Nintendo Power download game service and later for the Super Famicom itself. The game is a sequel to the original, which is included as a bonus in the game. Unlike the original, in which the player's objective was to find ways to clear each level of all panels, Wrecking Crew '98 takes a more competitive approach, where two opponents are given their own sides to clean up. Each player must try to demolish as many panels as they can on their side, until the opponent's side is completely piled up, to win.

The game's story mode features Mario returning to the Mushroom Kingdom from a trip, then discovering that Bowser has started a construction campaign of building new hideouts. The construction is depriving the flora of sunlight and thus, Mario decides to demolish the new construction sites with his hammer. Along the way, he meets his old enemies from the original Wrecking Crew, including former rival Foreman Spike.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wrecking_Crew_%28video_game%29 Wrecking Crew (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Ships of the Expanse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Expanse is vast, and traversing the space between worlds in the solar system requires a ship. For a crew, a ship is freedom, home, safety, and a source of income, but also a source of responsibility and often debt. Out in space, other ships are potential targets, allies, or threats. The Ships of the Expanse offers details on many of the kinds of space ships characters in an Expanse game might encounter, or perhaps even own. From shuttles and racing pinnaces to lumbering ice-haulers and massive warships, the sourcebook describes them all. Ships of the Expanse also features information on space stations and new rules for maintenance and repair, buying and selling cargo, new stunts and hazards, and much more.

boardgame.name: Breton
boardgame.description:
A surreal game with illustrations that invites us to let our imagination fly!

Breton offers 5 gameplay possibilities, inspired by surreal techniques: Exquisite Corpse, Reverie, Exquisite Illustrated Corpse, Collage, and Automatic Writing. Each one invites to unfold the imagination, some with writing proposals and others oral.

boardgame.name: Portal Stone
boardgame.description:
A duel between two willing participants, both aiming for the ultimate prize. The winner of this devilish game gets one wish granted, the loser, sacrificing their soul to pay for that wish.

GAMEPLAY
The aim of the game is to get 5 Portal Cards. Each player takes 1 of the two following actions on their turn, pass and repeat until a player has 5 Portal Cards:

1. CHARGE
Take one of your tokens and slide it onto the board from any one of the four sides.t the Portal Cards off to the side in a face down pile.

A) Tokens are played into a single square, pushing all other tokens in the same row up by a single

B) If you would cause an opponents token to slide off of the board then that player may place it back onto the board at the end of the turn, however this token cannot be used to push another token off of the board. That player would then take their turn as usual once the player whose current turn it is ends. If you can not place this token back onto the board without pushing another piece off of the board then this action is skipped. If you cause one of your own pieces to slide off of the board then this piece is forfeited.

C) If 5 tokens of a single colour are in a row, they are removed and the player that owns that colour takes one victory point.

2. CHANNEL*
Play a channel card from your hand if the conditions are met.

A) Show any cards from your hand and point out the requirements.

B) Remove the tokens on all matching squares of that cards requirements.

C) Gain points equal to the Portal Symbols on the bottom of the card.


Some cards have arrows on them, this means that you my play this card in your turn before or after your CHARGE action.

boardgame.name: Italian Railroads
boardgame.description:
This is Italian Railroads! The game is for 3-5 players and plays in less than an hour. It has one page of rules and new mechanisms. The suggested age is 47 and up.

The game is won by having the most victory points. Italy starts in the Kingdom Phase, advances to the Unification Phase, Privatisation Phase, then to the Modernization Phase, ending in the European Union Phase. Player have a choice during their turn: Take Stock or Place Stock.

The game is short, simple and moves fast. It requiring constant vigilance. It can get nasty, especially with the special rules for the Sicilian railroad.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Piacenza 1746
boardgame.description:
"Piacenza 1746" is Enrico Acerbi's board wargame, published by Europa Simulazioni, which depicts the "Battle of Piacenza" which was fought between a Franco-Spanish army and the Austrian army near Piacenza, in Northern Italy on June 16, 1746. It formed part of later operations in the War of the Austrian Succession. The result was a victory for the Austrian forces, led by Prince Josef Wenzel - Prince Franz Josef I and Louis-Joseph de Montcalm were among the notable combatants.

The War of the Austrian Succession (1740 - 1748) was a dynastic war, initiated by the European powers to counter the legitimate claim of Maria Theresa Habsburgs (1717-1780) to maintain control of all her family possessions, when her father, the Emperor Charles VI, died in 1740.

Federick II of Prussia was the first to act. He invaded Silesia as he wanted to reach a glorious military success and the beginning of his reign. Maria Theresa reacted prompted, and two alliance sides formed for the war with all the major European countries and many minor states involved.

In 1745, the war extended to Italy, where France and Spain were in arms against Austria and her ally, Savoy. After a sound defeat near Alessandria, the following year the Austrian side soundly defeated the French-Spanish army at the Battle of Piacenza, which marked the end of the French-Spain attempts to defeat Maria in Italy: "I want to hope that this event will dispel from the minds of my enemies the desire to totally banish myself from Italy"

Highlights:

regimental-level warfare in the Age of Reason
highly interactive sequence of play, focused on manoeuvre
formations move in "linear mode", the typical way of fighting a battle at that time
a 22" x 25" fine-art map , based on ancient map of the battle
detailed order of battle
limited play time


Components:

22" x 25" map of Piacenza and its southern area
216 5/8" (large) die-cut counters
Rule booklet
Charts
Boxed

boardgame.name: 6: Siege Year 5 Shadow Tactics Expansion
boardgame.description:
6: Siege - The Board Game is an asymmetrical tabletop game with miniatures for 2 to 4 players, based on Ubisoft’s acclaimed tactical shooter video game, Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six: Siege. Gameplay is fast and frenetic, allowing players to feel the tension of a cinematic assault with simulated real-time gameplay. Players control a team of 5 operators (all attackers or all defenders), with each Operator boasting different gadgets and abilities. Building your team of 5 is a very rewarding step of the game, offering endless possibilities and strategic choices. As the attacker, you will use your explosive arsenal to tear down walls and obstacles to reach your objective! As the defender, you will shape the battleground to your advantage and seek to thwart your opponent’s plans by denying them chances to attack.

"Year 5 - Shadow Tactics adds 6 operators to the base game. All of them being from the fifth year, or the fifth season, of the video game. They expand upon existing mechanisms and provide different options. And with the expanded roster, you’ll have more creative freedom while drafting your squad. Some Operators really benefit from synergies, while others are particularly suited for a specific environment

For attackers, we have Iana with her Gemini Replicator. She creates holo doubles and sows confusion among enemies. Ace, from Norway, is a demolition specialist who can crumble floors and ceilings, making some spaces impassable. On top of that, this season sees Zero return! Zero as the famous (or infamous!) Sam Fisher himself… With his Argus cameras, he will force opponents to move a certain way.

On the defenders’ side, Oryx’s charges are a force to be reckoned with. He can run and crash through walls! Melusi and Aruni add traps and countermeasures on the field thanks to Banshee Sonic Defences or Surya Lasers.

—description from the publisher"
